intro: Oxygraphis cymbalaria var. kawakamii, commonly known as the Kawakamii bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic habit, often found in wetlands and shallow water bodies. The plant features slender, branching stems with small, scale-like leaves and produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations to aquatic habitats and its role in wetland ecosystems.
